caption: Really great food from Chef Lisa! The pork belly was amazing

Absolutely amazing! We found this place via Restaurant Week and it’s going to be our to go place for Asian fusion food 🍲 it was so good I forgot to take a pic but believe me you are not going to be disappointed. Even with the fix menu for the Restaurant Week everything is fair portioned and delicious. And the owner is just a cherry on top. Will be back soon!  Update: went two weeks later and the food still delicious and drinks are an adventure!
I had the Restaurant Week 2021 special: pork dumplings, chicken with rice and tiramisu for desert. I would definitely return as these were all exceptional.
Great food, definitely a go to place. The owner is extremely nice. The pancakes, pad Thai and tirasimu are to die for
(Translated by Google) Delicious fresh  (Original) Delicioso fresco
Pho and loaded fries to warm up and enjoy some outdoor seating! Check out IG-newyorkcitymunchies for more 📸
Very disappointing. Wouldn't return.

The drinks were excellent... The fries were bomb... The food was - well decent. Awesome staff and friendly as can be but idk, I had much higher expectations tbh. I would go back for a small quick bite and a drink but that's really it..
Pretty good
Very bland. Maybe this is Asian food for people who have no idea what Asian food is supposed to taste like. You couldn't pay me to return.
Horrible horrible horrible! Bland food and the dishes are mainly rice. I can't believe how bad this is.

Ordered takeout during NYC Restaurant Week.It was amazing - all of it! The pork dumplings, sweet chili chicken and vietnamese coffee tiramisu, I enjoyed every single bite. Portions were very generous, definitely recommend it for asian cuisine in the Williamsburg-Bushwick area
Everything I’ve tried here is on point. Love the gluten free options especially. On time delivery too!!
Had a great experience in this spot with my kids. The food came fast and the customer service is just awesome. Prices are convenient.
Delicious, scrumptious, busting.

Amazing food every time and phenomenal drinks. The sriracha fries are out of this world and the bahn mi is out of this universe. A fantastic place to eat with an awesome vibe, friendly servers, and no bad item on the menu. Love this place!
Lisa is awesome and their food is absolutely dynamite! It's a wonderful neighborhood joint.

Everything at Sweet Chili is phenomenal, from the cocktails, to the sriracha fries, and the noodles. The service is also incredibly quick, and if you're a 'Top Chef' fan, chef Lisa Fernades is a total icon.
You can't go wrong at sweet chili.  Amazing and talented chef who knows how to satisfy a bland palate. Dumplings are to die for.

First off, I had no idea the Chef of this place is a former contestant from Top Chef . So ,having a neighborhood celebrity prepare your food for you is always exciting. Second and most importantly, the food , the cocktails and the service. All three get 5 stars. The Food  “ Thiaetnamese” as Chef Fernandes calls it , was not only different, but full of flavor and super fresh . The cocktails were MIND BLOWING , with names like : Purple People Eater , Cherry Bomb and  Bushwick Passion. Each one was not overly sweet, but had intense flavor that used unique ingredients. The servers were knowledgeable about all the food and drink options and were very attentive and motivated. Definitely kid friendly, Can’t wait to go back . Thank you Chef Fernandes!
Great place, incredible drinks, and friendly staff. This place is a must if you're ever in the neighborhood.

I would honestly give them place between 3.5 and 3 stars. They have outdoor seating which is great and they take your temp. It took us a very long time to order despite not being the busy. The wings had a great sauce but it was so hard !! It was like eating old wings that were refried a bunch of times. I didn’t go during happy hour so would not recommend full price. The dumpling were alright. I also got the pork belly which had the same problem of feeling like it was old. The problem here is that the meat didn’t feel fresh. The sauce on the other hand was amazing. Very flavorful.
The food was amazing!!!!
This is the best restuarant happy hour in the neighborhood!
I like the place, nice calm and chill spot i just wish they had the heat on inside.

The food is AMAZING!!! Highly recommend going during happy hour (every day until 6pm) for $1 dumplings & wings in sweet chili sauce. Their cocktails are also delicious. This is my new fave Brooklyn Thai spot!
Shocking laksa terrible attitude

Love this restaurant! Both the food and staff are wonderful. Been multiplie times now and keep coming back for more amazing food! Some particular favorites are the crispy pork dumplings, sriracha fries, Szechuan pork & eggplant and shrimp pad Thai. And the Vietnamese coffee tiramisu for dessert! And pre-covid the inside dining was cozy and now with outside dining the outside eating spot is done really nicely. Love it here and highly recommend!

What makes this place is the service. Nicole and John are just amazing people. Originally my friend and I were going to Northwinds, but they were full in outdoor seating and these people did not look like they were going to move for a long while. We noticed immediately next door was Sweet Chili. We were so happy to dine here. Only 1 table was occupied,  but by the time we started ordering,  the place was full. We dat down at 555pm, 5 mins before the end of happy hour and John allowed us to order happy hour drinks and food. We ordered the $1 dumplings and $1 wings. The wings were ok, but the dumplings were really good.  I ordered the Bangkok Mule, and it was very refreshing.  My friend ordered the Pandan painkiller which has alot of rum, but was very subtle in in strength. It was really good. I then ordered a Liquid Pad Thai, again a really good drink but felt light or maybe I had too much already,  who knows. The drink did not last long and then I ordered the Spicy Watermelon drink and that was amazingly refreshing.  Meanwhile for food, I ordered the combo which included a vegetable roll, General Tso's chicken and broccoli with rice and i also ordered the papaya salad. The papaya salad was not bad, not as spicy as I was hoping for but very edible.  During this whole time, both John and Nicole kept checking back and they are both awesome in terms of customer service. Nicole is beautiful inside and outside. They both recommended good menu suggestions and they were spot on. I made sure I gave them a nice tip for their services. It was certainly worth it. I would without hesitation return here even just for the drinks.
Great dishes. Awesome seating area too.
I really love the food. Appetizers to the main course.

I told my friends about this place with my highest recommendations. I go their often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The meals are yummy and the crew is generous and cooperative. Every time  we go to this place we pass a delightful evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.

Visited on Saturday and had a great experience. The food was delicious, I had the dumplings and sriracha fries. My partner had the wings, which were also great! Tried a couple of their cocktails and was not disappointed. On top of this the service was excellent, warm and friendly. Would definitely recommend!

Pork dumplings are really good, with a balance of sweet and spicy. The chicken sandwich is a steal. Sizable cutlet of fried chicken with heat and sweet. Only thing I'd do differently is to get the sriracha fries. Next time for sure. Pro tip, pour the sauce from the dumplings on the fries. Also, the Frozen Painkiller is 10 outta 10, no doubt.
The food is outstanding! the wings are knockout.
I really liked their food and customer service, fantastic area close to my home. The cashiers are always very welcoming. Will come back again.

Got takeout on my way home from work - the food was excellent, staff was welcoming and the store was clean (clearly keeping up with their COVID protocol). Spicy chicken sandwich, bok choy, and dumplings all A+. I will he back.
Came here for brunch and it was delicious. We got three entrees and split them between the two of us. Reasonably priced and delicious! Definitely recommend the Bahn Mi Benedict!!

Went here at the opening night.  Best pork belly I've ever had in my life. Was so soft and flavorful, and it really worked well with the crispness of the side vegetables.  Really awesome restaurant and I can't wait for an opportunity for me to commute back and see the changes and try out the bar!

Amazing food with a great ambiance. Would recommend anyone to come and try this fantastic food, it’ll play with your taste buds and leave you craving more. For a one if a kind experience try the liquid pad Thai drink!
I'd give this place 1,000 stars. Excellent food and drinks

Great food. Can’t go wrong with anything on the menu. Highlights are the happy hour scallion pancakes, the dumplings, pad Thai, red curry shrimp and pork belly!  Also really inventive and delicious cocktails. Awesome service with very friendly staff!
We ordered tons of food, everything was amazing, the service was excellent. Would definitely recommend.

Fantastic brunch. Started with the Sriracha fries and pork dumplings. So many fries and excellent starter before having the rice cake for brunch. The French toast was a win and the banh mi was delicious (and messy). Also save room for the dessert and enjoy the $4 brunch cocktails. Highly recommended.

This place is simply amazing! I tried both menus (brunch & dinner) and the fact of having a mix of sweet, sour, spicy and crunchy in EACH dish is just clever and deliciously good. To me, it’s like Mission Chinese but way cheaper ! Excited to become a regular of this neighbourhood spot.

My wife and I used to meet up for lunch from the food truck and were thrilled when we heard Chef Lisa Fernandes had opened a brick and mortar restaurant on Flushing Ave in Bushwick.  While in the neighborhood we decided to stop by for dinner, and we were so glad we did!  Everyone working there was incredibly friendly and the entire place felt so warm and welcoming.  We have an 18mo daughter and appreciate that they are kid-friendly, while also being a nice place to go and hang out and have some drinks with dinner too.  They have high chairs and a changing table in their wonderfully-gender-neutral bathroom.  There is even a kid's menu, and our daughter loved her chicken fried rice.  Chef Lisa has outdone herself and expanded her menu from the food truck, while keeping many of the classic flavors we had enjoyed before.  There are also fun, unique drinks and dessert options.  If you live in the area or are passing through, definitely put this place on your list!
Wonderful wings, delicious dumplings, terrific tofu, delectable desserts, potent potables, and sweet staff! See what I did there? All true at Sweet Chili!

Had brunch here and loved it! Pork belly was fantastic, Sriracha fries too! Ended up trying 3 cocktails... great Bloody Mary but the Gin & Juice here is my new favourite. The food my friends had was also really tasty and really interesting, flavourful take on Vietnamese and Thai food. No surprise the owner did so well on Top Chef. Service was friendly and fast too. I definitely want to go back to try the dinner menu soon. Highly recommended if you're looking for great tasting food in Bushwick.
Food is awesome. Staff are friendly!

Amazing food and service (and bonus points for super fun music too)! I ordered the Maple Miso Tofu, which was beyond delicious! Honestly, I love tofu dishes, but have had many terrible ones. This one is definitely crave-worthy, even for meat eaters. The cocktails were also fantastic, and they have an amazing happy hour, with drink and app specials (hello, a scallion pancake app for $3?? AND it was SO good!). Absolutely recommend, both owners came out and greeted us, and were beyond hospitable.

An absolutely delicious and fun addition to the neighborhood! I had dinner there with a few friends the other night and the cocktail was on point and the food (I had the scallion pancakes and tofu with jasmine rice) was so, so tasty. Not too salty, it was seasoned just right. The music and lighting was fun too and our server was great to us. We WILL be back!

I don’t even know where to start, this place is amazing, the service was excellent, I went with my boyfriend and his friend and we had a great experience, we had the Sriracha fries( which is a must to try), the crispy watercress salad (which was one my favorite),the Red curry shrimp that comes with the best jasmine rice, Crispy pork dumplings, Yellow curry fried rice, not to mention mouth watering NY strip-coriander marinade with green papaya salad, peanut butter mashed potatoes😍 and many more but this is a place you have to try it’s amazing for a little date and they also do brunch which I’m dying to try out but all I can say you won’t be disappointed the service and the food was excellent. Thank you guys for the amazing service....
Wow, unassuming and delicious!! Such wonderful flavor and diversity on this menu. Perfect for the neighborhood :) :)

I took my parents to brunch here today, and we loved everything about the place. The pork belly bahn mi benedict was perfect--a little spicy, a little messy, and full of flavor. Great vibe in the place and the service was great. I was surprised it wasn't busier, frankly. If you're looking for interesting, delicious food, you should check it out. I'll definitely be back!
It’s good. Bartender was nice. I like. You should like too.

Cozy, vibrant, and, most importantly, delicious. My wife and I couldn't get enough. If you have room for it, definitely grab a side of the maple bacon or bok choy. Interesting flavors in a place you feel cool hanging out in. Highly recommended!

A lot of tasty stuff here.  The "Spicy Bacon & Peanut Bites" were something special, really intense amount of flavor packed into one spoon.  The cocktails were fun too, a Pho cocktail and a Pad Thai cocktail, both quite creative and intriguing.  The ambience is alright, would like to hear some different dance music (was a bit too festival EDM for my taste), but the spot is definitely a welcomed addition to the area and I'm excited to see how it evolves.  Fantastic service too, our server was bringing the good energy!

My friend recommended this spot to me, and man, was he right! Love the design, the concept and the food is sooo good. So much flavor. As a Latino Bushwick  native that’s what I look forward to in food. Definitely a breath of fresh air for Bushwick. The Dumplings are a must try!

We all know there are places in BK that try to be cool,  but sweet chili doesn’t have to try. The food is really good, but most of all unique. I had the pork and eggplant entree with the broccoli as a side. I had to order the broccoli twice because I refused to share it. I’m def coming back!
Service was amazing! Food was so tasty! You can't go wrong with the pork belly or the yellow curry rice, but everything we had on the menu was delicious! Great drinks too!

Awesome cocktails, even better food. With New York being flooded with Asian/Asian fusion restaurants, this place is such a breath of fresh air. If you're looking for some different comfort food with the perfect level of spice, this is the place.
Lovely food and lovely staff 🥰
Amazing food! Great service! I will definitely go back ❤️

The food was really delicious, and just the right amount of spice. We went as a group and shared several dishes - watercress salad, Sriracha fries, pineapple fried rice, pork belly, book chop, broccoli, and dumplings. Everything was really great! The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable. Great for a date or a large group.
The food, drinks and service provided tonight were unparalleled. I can't wait to come back to try brunch.

Ate here the other night and absolutely loved it! The dish sizes are perfect for either a tapas style dinner or individual plates. My friends and I ordered the shrimp and watercress salad, the pan-fried dumplings (hiiiii), and the whole fish. I’m not usually a fish person but damnnnnn that fish! And I’m honestly still thinking about that tiramisu 😋😋  The service is excellent and the food comes out quickly. Can’t recommend enough.

LOVE the food here. Everything is cooked perfectly and the meals are packed with flavor. There's nothing on the menu I wouldn't order. Definitley unlike any other restaurant in Bushwick. Perfect for a date night or group hang.
Soooooo frustrating. Very disorganized service. They can't manage a full house. Imagine we ordered first in our group and we receive it the last. Dont recommend this place.

Delicious and flavorful menu. It’s southeast Asian with Vietnamese and Thai influence. Spicy without being too spicy. I had the chicken wings, rice cakes, and duck. The rice cakes were spicy and chewy. I could have eaten a bucket of them. The sauce on the chicken wings was spicy and sweet. Yummm. I had a bottle of Sauvignon blanc that went well with the meal. I’ll definitely be back
